title: Bellman
description: Bellman Graph is an algorithm that computes shortest paths from a single source vertex to all of the other vertices in a weighted digraph

title: Dijkstra
description: Dijkstra is used for finding the shortest distance, or path, from starting node to target node in a weighted graph.

title: Graph Coloring
description: Graph Coloring is a problem of assigning colors to vertices of a graph so that no two adjacent vertices have the same color. The problem is NP-complete and can be solved using greedy algorithms.

title: Kruskal
description: Kruskal is an algorithm for finding the minimum spanning tree of a weighted, connected and undirected graph.
